title: Question 16
prompt: Which of the following quotations from the women’s discussion best expresses why Hannah loves her daughter Sula?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Hannah’s friend says, “Can’t help loving your own child.” She is talking about her own son. Her other friend disagrees, claiming that she doesn’t love her grown daughter. Hannah then contradicts the second friend, saying that she does love her daughter, like Hannah loves Sula. Hannah is agreeing with the first friend’s statement. She can’t help loving Sula, because Sula is her own child.


“Sure I do. But he still a pain. Can’t help loving your own child. No matter what they do.”

“Well, Hester grown now and I can’t say love is exactly what I feel.”

“Sure you do. You love her, like I love Sula. I just don’t like her. That’s the difference.”
